availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Gartlin (Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky, blacksmith)

body.p: Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky, blacksmith. Native of Ireland. Married to Catherine Gartlin. Blacksmith in Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky, in 1860. Blacksmith in Fayette County in 1864. Charged with receiving stolen goods in Fayette County in February 1865. Fugitive from justice in Ohio in June 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington Ward 4, p. 541.
Williams' Lexington City Directory, for 1864-1865: To Which is Appended a United States Post Office Directory (Lexington, KY: 1864), 97.
KYR-0001-006-0064.
